media:group.media:description:
๐ Armeniaโs 1,000 biggest companies paid nearly $2.6 billion in taxes in the first half of the year, a year-on-year increase of about 9.5%, according to the latest quarterly top taxpayers list. ๐ Armeniaโs government approved plans to grow exports by 70% by 2030, earmarking more than $255 million in public money for the effort. ๐ Ardshinbank, Armeniaโs biggest lender, confirmed it is bidding to purchase HSBCโs Maltese subsidiary. Ardshinbank took over HSBCโs Armenian operations last year.

media:group.media:title: Roundtable: Russiaโs Move South
media:group.media:description:
Renowned historians Ronald Suny, Dominic Lieven, Valentina Izmirlieva, and Thomas de Waal participate in a roundtable discussion titled "Russia's Move South." They explore Russia's centuries-long drive southward - from escaping the infertile northern lands around Moscow to conquering the fertile Black Sea steppes. Dominic Lieven examines Catherine II's decisive victories over the Ottoman Empire that transformed the balance of power. Thomas de Waal contrasts different imperial strategies: American-style colonization in "New Russia" versus brutal conquest in the North Caucasus and co-optation of elites in the Transcaucasus. Valentina Izmirlieva reveals the ironic story of Russian refugees finally reaching Constantinople - not as conquerors but as exiles who transformed Ottoman urban culture. Ronald Suny challenges Cold War narratives about Soviet formation, showing how the empire emerged from civil war complexity rather than simple Russian conquest. The roundtable was held on June 27 in Batumi as part of a symposium organized by the Monterey Initiative in Russian Studies at the Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey. The 2025 Monterey Summer Symposium on Russia took place in Batumi, Yerevan, and Tbilisi from June 25 to July 13.

media:group.media:description:
Armeniaโs largest reservoir, Akhuryan, was launched under a USSR-Turkey interstate agreement and is still managed through technical cooperation between the two sidesโdespite the absence of diplomatic relations. media:group.media:title: Armenia backs two-state solution in IsraeliโPalestinian conflict
media:group.media:description:
๐ At an event dedicated to the humanitarian crisis in Gaza, held in New York at the United Nations, Armenian Deputy Foreign Minister Vahan Kostanyan reiterated Yerevanโs support for the two-state solution as the only viable path to lasting peace in the Middle East. ๐ The Armenian government noted that while it is open to outsourcing the business management of infrastructure projects, any transfer of territorial control or legal jurisdiction of transport roads remains out of the question. ๐ Following years of delay, Armenia will launch a mandatory health insurance system next year, setting the stage for a sweeping overhaul of the countryโs healthcare financing model, Health Minister Anahit Avanesyan announced. ๐ Uncovered garbage containers pose serious health, environmental problems for Yerevan residents: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XHcbDus74ag

ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีงีฌีฅีฏีฟึีกีฏีกีถ ึีกีถึีฅึ ีจีถีฏีฅึีธึีฉีตีกีถ (ีิที) ีทีธึึีป ีฝีฟีฅีฒีฎีพีกีฎ ีญีถีคีซึีถ ีกึีคีฅีถ ีจีถีคีฐีกีฟีฅีฌ ีง ีญีธีทีธึ ีถีฅึีคึีธึีดีถีฅึ, ีถีดีกีถ ีฟีฅีฒีฅีฏีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึ ีฏีกีถ. ีกีฝีธึีด ีง ีงีฏีธีถีธีดีซีฏีกีตีซ ีถีกีญีฏีซีถ ีถีกีญีกึีกึ ีีกีฐีกีถ ีีฅึีธีขีตีกีถีจ ยซีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉ ีขีซีฆีถีฅีฝีซยป ีฐีฅีฟ ีฐีกึึีกีฆึีธึีตึีธึีด: ีีก ีฏีกีฝีฏีกีฎีธึีด ีง, ีธึ ีิที-ีซ ีบีฅีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีฏีกีผีกีพีกึีธึีดีจ ีคึีกีฏีกีถ ีกีฆีคีฅึีธึีฉีตีธึีถ ีฏีธึีถีฅีถีก ีฐีกีดีกีฏีกึีฃีซ ีพึีก ึ ีถีทีธึีด ีง, ีธึ ีฐีกีถึีกีตีซีถ ีฎีกีผีกีตีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีจ ีฏีกีผีกีพีกึีฅีฌีธึ ีบีฅีฟีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฃีธึีฎีซึีกีฏีกีฆีดีจ ีญีซีฝีฟ ีฝีกีฐีดีกีถีกึีกีฏ ีง: ิฑีตีฝ ีฐีกีดีกีฟีฅึีฝีฟีธึีด ีีฅึีธีขีตีกีถีจ ีขีฅึีธึีด ีง ยซิถีพีกึีฉีถีธึยป ึ ีคีกีถีกีพีกีฏีกีตีกีถีซ ึ ึีซีถีกีฏีจ` ีถีทีฅีฌีธีพ, ีธึ ีบีฅีฟีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ ีฏีธีถึีฅีฝีซีธีถ ีฏีกีผีกีพีกึีนีซ ีถีฏีกีฟีดีกีดีข ีกีพีฅีฌีซ ึีกีถ 500 ีดีฌีถ ีคีธีฌีกึีซ ีบีกึีฟีกีพีธึีธึีฉีตีธึีถ ีธึีถีซ:
0:00 - ยซิปีด ีฃีธึีฎีธีพ ีพีฏีกีถีฅึีซ ีพึีก ีธึีชีฅีฒ ีณีถีทีธึีด ีง ีฃีธึีฎีกีคึีพีฅีฌยป 2:44 - ิตีึีข ีฏีกีพีกึีฟีพีซ ีีฅึีธีขีตีกีถีซ ีฃีธึีฎีธีพ ีคีกีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีฃีธึีฎีจีถีฉีกึีจ 5:30 - ิณีถีธึีดีถีฅึีซ ึ ีบีฅีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีฏีกีผีกีพีกึีดีกีถ ีธีฌีธึีฟีถีฅึีธึีด ีญีถีคีซึีถีฅึีจ 9:01 - ยซีีฅึีคึีธึีดีถีฅึีจ ีฐีซีดีกีฏีกีถีธึีด ีฟีฅีญีถีซีฏีกีฟีถีฟีฅีฝีกีฏีกีถ ีพีฅึีฌีธึีฎีธึีฉีตีธึีถ ีนีฅีถ ีกีถึีถีธึีดยป 12:18 - ิฑึีฟีกีฐีกีถีดีกีถ ีฆีกึีฃีกึีดีกีถ ีผีกีฆีดีกีพีกึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีดีกีฝีซีถ 16:48 - ีิที-ีซ ีญีถีคีซึีจ ีญีธีทีธึ ีพีถีกีฝ ีง ีฐีกีฝึีถีธึีด ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีถีฅึีคึีธึีดีกีตีซีถ ีซีดีซีปีซีถ 21:37 - ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีจ ีณีซีทีฟ ีนีซี ีพีกึีพีธึีด ีถีฅึีคึีธีฒีถีฅึีซ ีฐีฅีฟ 22:25 - ีีกีถึีกีตีซีถ ีฎีกีผีกีตีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีจ ีฏีกีผีกีพีกึีฅีฌีธึ ีบีฅีฟีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฏีกึีธีฒีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถ 29:22 - ิฟีกีผีกีพีกึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ ีบีกึีฟีกีพีธึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅีึ ีง ีฏีธึีฟีกีฏีฅีฌ ยซิถีพีกึีฉีถีธึยป ึ ีคีกีถีกีพีกีฏีกีตีกีถีซ ีฏีธีถึีฅีฝีซีธีถ ีฏีกีผีกีพีกึีนีซีถ 33:25 - ีีถีฟีฅีฝีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถ ีกีณีธึีด ีง, ีกึีฟีกึีซีถ ีกีผึีฟีธึึีจ ีฏึีณีกีฟีพีธึีด 36:48 - ยซีีฅึีกีกึีฟีกีฐีกีถีธึีดีจ ีฐีกีตีฅึีซ ีฝีซึีกีฎ ีฆีขีกีฒีดีธึีถึีจ ีบีฅีฟึ ีง ีฌีซีถีซยป
